IX.iii.1.A.5.m
.
Handling Income That Exceeds the MAPR for the Initial Year
In a pension case, the initial year extends from the effective date of the award (or later date of the Veteran’s death) to one year from the payment date.
If payment is barred for the initial year because income exceeds the MAPR but income for the following 12-month period is below the MAPR, pay from the beginning of the following 12-month period.  Although this is an original award,
38 CFR 3.31
has already been factored into the initial year.
